solution_line_template: He does the long drive {days_in_week}-{short_drive_days}=<<{days_in_week}-{short_drive_days}={long_drive_days}>>{long_drive_days} days a week

So he drives a total of {short_drive_days}*{short_drive_miles}+{long_drive_days}*{long_drive_miles}=<<{short_drive_days}*{short_drive_miles}+{long_drive_days}*{long_drive_miles}={total_miles_per_week}>>{total_miles_per_week} miles a week
That means the car cost {total_miles_per_week}*{cost_per_mile}=$<<{total_miles_per_week}*{cost_per_mile}={mileage_cost_per_week}>>{mileage_cost_per_week} just for the mileage per week
So he pays {weekly_fee}+{mileage_cost_per_week}=$<<{weekly_fee}+{mileage_cost_per_week}={total_weekly_cost}>>{total_weekly_cost} per week for the car
That means the total cost of the car is {total_weekly_cost}*{weeks_per_year}=$<<{total_weekly_cost}*{weeks_per_year}={total_yearly_cost}>>{total_yearly_cost} a year
